alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 5:43AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Central Alabama, including the following county, Calhoun. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 543 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anniston, Oxford, Jacksonville, Fort McClellan, Saks, Weaver, Blue Mountain, Jacksonville State University, Alexandria and Dearmanville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
